subject: Web3
title: Fake Customer Support Scams
description: One-minute skill: Fake Customer Support Scams.

hook.text: Ask for help on crypto Twitter and fake support accounts appear within seconds, ready to steal your funds.

buildup.text: Scammers create accounts that look like official support for MetaMask, Coinbase, or other platforms.

discovery.text: They ask victims to 'verify' their wallet by entering their seed phrase on a fake website. The phrase gives full access.

twist.text: No legitimate service will ever ask for your seed phrase. Yet thousands of people hand it over under pressure.

climax.text: Fake support scams are low-tech but devastatingly effective. They prey on panic and trust.

punchline.text: Real support never asks for your seed phrase. Scammers always do.

quiz.question: What should you never share with anyone claiming to be crypto support?
options: Your seed phrase or private keys
